On Oct 12, 2009, at 8:56 PM, Felipe Ga=FAcho wrote:

> can you provide me =
a short example of description using rel ?
>
> that's what I am focusing no=
w.. I am just looking for good examples
> (please don't point to atompub)
>=


Well, AtomPub is probably the best example because it is somewhat the  
o=
nly one that stretches into the non-human web. :-)

There is also

- Opense=
arch (opensearch.org)
- the IANA link relation registry (<http://www.iana.o=
rg/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml 
 >)
- Google's pubsub a=
t http://code.google.com/p/pubsubhubbub

There are more, but they don't com=
e to mind right now.

Actually, you can go a pretty long way with the above=
 specs and some  
additional link relations. The hardest part is IMO to rea=
lly figure  
out what interface issues are actually implementation details.=
 Many  
aspects of a an interface can be handled by e.g. a category on an  =

AtomPub collections that tells the client a certain set of  
expectations =
to make about the collection.

Jan
